thread.title: S Club singer rushed to hospital and may need surgery
thread.title_full: S Club singer rushed to hospital and may need surgery

title: S Club singer rushed to hospital and may need surgery
text:
S Club singer rushed to hospital and may need surgery Last updated 13:36, February 4 2017 Demelza Andreoli 
Only two members of S Club will perform in Auckland. 
S Club singer Jo O'Meara has been rushed to hospital for possible surgery for a strangulated bowel. 
O'Meara pulled out of the pop group's concert in Auckland on Friday night, with promoters saying she was suffering from a severe bout of food poisoning. 
On Saturday, concert venue ASB Theatre said in a statement O'Meara had been rushed to hospital early on Friday morning, "where it was confirmed she has a condition known as strangulated bowel and needs immediate medical attention which could result in a fairly major operation". 
Event organisers confirm only two members of S Club would perform in Auckland 
"Jo would sincerely like to apologise to all the fans she feels she let down for being unable to perform yesterday's opening night of the tour and is keeping her fingers crossed that all goes well and she can be back out on stage with the other guys in Australia." 
READ MORE: *Best and worst of the B*Witched, S Club 3, Atomic Kitten, Liberty X 90s revival 
The statement said if O'Meara did not need the operation, she could re-join band mates Tina Barrett and Bradley McIntosh for the Australian leg of their tour. 
Meanwhile, Barrett and McIntosh would perform in Auckland on Saturday night. "They promise a great show even through Jo might be absent." 
The 90s popular pop groups including S Club 3, B*Witched, Atomic Kitten and Liberty X, were to perform two nights in Auckland.
